newsitem.title: CHINA: China coal mine explosion kills 18, three missing.
newsitem.headline: China coal mine explosion kills 18, three missing.

text.p: A gas explosion at a coal mine in the Pingdingshan mining district in central China has killed 18 miners and left three missing, local officials said on Tuesday.
The blast occurred in the afternoon of March 20 in a state-owned coal mine in northern Henan province, a local government official said by telephone.
The explosion of gas in the state-owned Dazhuang mine about 50 km (30 miles) west of the town of Pingdingshan had killed 18 miners and left three missing, the official said.
He said there was little hope of finding any survivors.
The cause of the explosion was under investigation.
The blast followed a series of explosions that ripped through three privately owned coal mines in Pingdingshan county this month, killing 86 miners.
